Class ObstaclePool

java.lang.Object
pools.ObstaclePool
public class ObstaclePool extends Object
ObstaclePool - Reuses obstacles instead of creating new ones Week 10 Branch 10-04: OBJECT POOL PATTERN SOLUTION ✅ SOLUTION: Pre-allocate obstacles and reuse them! ✅ SOLUTION: No new objects = No garbage = No GC pauses! ✅ SOLUTION: Stable 60 FPS performance Teaching Points: - Object pooling eliminates GC pressure - Trade memory (keep objects) for performance (no GC) - Essential for real-time applications (games, servers)

    Create obstacle pool with pre-allocation

  • Constructor Details

    • ObstaclePool

      public ObstaclePool(ObstacleFactory factory, int initialSize, int maxSize)
      Create obstacle pool with pre-allocation
      Parameters:
      factory - Factory for creating this type of obstacle
      initialSize - How many to pre-allocate (one-time cost)
      maxSize - Maximum pool size (safety limit)

  • Method Details

    • acquire

      public Obstacle acquire(int x, int y)
      Borrow an obstacle from the pool ✅ REUSES existing object instead of creating new one!
      Parameters:
      x - Spawn X position
      y - Spawn Y position
      Returns:
      Reused obstacle, or null if pool exhausted

    • release

      public void release(Obstacle obstacle)
      Return obstacle to pool for reuse ✅ Object stays in memory instead of being garbage collected!
      Parameters:
      obstacle - The obstacle to return

    • ownsObstacle

      public boolean ownsObstacle(Obstacle obstacle)
      Check if obstacle belongs to this pool

      public int getAvailableCount()
      Get count of available obstacles (ready to borrow)

    • getTotalSize

      public int getTotalSize()
      Get total pool size (all objects, borrowed + available)

    • getInUseCount

      public int getInUseCount()
      Get count of currently borrowed obstacles

    • printStats

      public void printStats(String poolName)
      Print pool statistics (for debugging) Week 12-01: Enhanced to show "Actually Spawned" instead of just "Total Created"
